Cross Direction Layout and updated documentation

- Added methods to enable and disable navigation logics at runtime.
- Added options to get alternative horizontal layout; sections are
stacked vertically and pages are arranged horizontally.
- Added option to reconfigure key bindings for some wireless presenters.
([#15](https://github.com/marcolago/flowtime.js/issues/15))

Merge pull request #25 from xogeny/master

Added clicker support for Flowtime.

Well done. Thank you!

Added clicker support for Flowtime

For those using presenter devices, like the Logitech R400, the normal key mappings
in Flowtime don't make sense because the next and prev buttons really just jump
to the top and bottom of sections (which isn't very useful).

This change adds a function to the public API called .  When set to true,
the bindings are changed so that keycodes 33 and 34 are used for slide navigation
(instead of top of section and bottom of section).

This change is completely backwards compatible and the default is to keep the
old behavior.  Enabling the clicker support really doesn't change much anyway because
I never used the previous functions of keycodes 33 and 34 anyway.

Added Custom Fragment Animations Example

A very simple example to show how to customize the fragment animation.
Feel free to add any costom animations and classes you like.

Added Custom Fragment Animations Example

A very simple example to show how to customize the fragment animation.
Feel free to add any costom animations and classes you like.

Merge pull request #24 from mathbruyen/patch-1

Left align content in list items

Left align content in list items

Putting a list inside a centered context makes items content centered while it is expected they remain aligned on their bullets.

Fixed Touch Device Detection Bug in Firefox

Improved the touch device detection and events management to make links
navigation works (again) in Firefox.

Added some APIs to disable navigation; they works but are still
undocumented.
Fix a link issue in overview mode
Fixed event handlers for older IE

Added loop and autoplay features (#18)

Now it's possible to autoplay the presentation with start, pause and
stop methods and loop through the last and the first sections and pages.

Memory optimizations for a more stable mobile experience.

Added Horizontal/Vertical Wheel/Trackpad Scroll

Added horizontal and vertical mousewheel and trackpad scroll navigation.
Works on Firefox/Chrome/Safari/Opera but there is currently no support
in IE.
On Safari for Windows (no longer developed) the horizontal scrolling is
reversed.
